awd_titl_txt: Presidential Young Investigator Award:  Topics in QCD and   the Weak Interactions
awd_abstract_narration: It is proposed to exploit some of the new information on                   hadronic structure which is becoming available as a result of                   recent experiments on polarized targets.  There are interesting                 form factors which provide information on the structure of the                  proton, measurable in elastic neutrino-proton scattering.  New                  structure functions can be measured in deep inelastic                           scattering from higher spin targets.  Electrodynamics in the                    presence of anomalous vortices will also be studied.  The                       vortices exhibit birefringence and optical activity; there is                   antiscreaning of charge.  This leads to relations, which will                   be investigated, among quantization of charge, anomalies and                    the periodicity of the theta parameter.  Efforts will also be                   made to put limits on the mass of the Higgs boson and to                        develop a model for fermion masses based on flavor democracy.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
